column4: heya, If openoffice won't open a word document that i need to edit, what other program should i use?
k
is it in the repositories?
openoffice.org2
well, you can't install the package from universe, but you could try my vanilla .debs
what is that?  my vanilla .debs?
plain, unpatched but packaged for debian
I haven't tested against warty but the dependencies aren't very heavy so there is a fair chance it will work
you'll need -core and -writer
looking into it, thanks
only core and writer?
yes that will give you .doc import capability, I would try installing just those two to begin with - you can add the rest later if it works
please let me know if it works for you
i have never installed a file like this before
add the deb line to your sources.list and then you'll see the new packages in your package manager
so i don't download them?
apt/aptitude/synaptic does that for you
i know that... just used to downloading things to install... wasn't sure if i had to download first
almost done . . .
actually gonna take awhile to download it...
in 30 min i will let you know if it worked  . .
thanks
